titles: A true report of the disputation or rather priuate conference had in the Tower of London, with Ed. Campion Iesuite, the last of August. 1581. Set downe by the reuerend learned men them selues that dealt therein. VVhereunto is ioyned also a true report of the other three dayes conferences had there with the same Iesuite. Which nowe are thought meete to be published in print by authoritie
author: Nowell, Alexander, 1507?-1602.
Day, William, 1529-1596. aut
Fielde, John, d. 1588.
Fulke, William, 1538-1589. aut
Goad, Roger, 1538-1610. aut
Campion, Edmund, Saint, 1540-1581. aut
Walker, John, d. 1588. aut
Charke, William, d. 1617. aut
publisher: By Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes most excellent Maiestie,
notes: "To the reader" signed: A. Nowell. VV. Daije.

"The three last dayes conferences had in the Tower with Edmund Campion Iesuite, the 18: 23: and 27. of September. 1581. collected and faithfully set downe by M. Iohn Feilde" has divisional title; register is continuous. This records conferences with William Fulke and Roger Goad, and with John Walker and William Charke.
This edition has errata on the title page verso.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
